gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 17,26]]Jesus said to his disciples: “As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be in the days of the Son of Man;
[[Lc 17,27]]they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage up to the day that Noah entered the ark, and the flood came and destroyed them all.
[[Lc 17,28]]Similarly, as it was in the days of Lot: they were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, building;
[[Lc 17,29]]on the day when Lot left Sodom, fire and brimstone rained from the sky to destroy them all.
[[Lc 17,30]]So it will be on the day the Son of Man is revealed.
[[Lc 17,31]]On that day, a person who is on the housetop and whose belongings are in the house must not go down to get them, and likewise a person in the field must not return to what was left behind.
[[Lc 17,32]]Remember the wife of Lot.
[[Lc 17,33]]Whoever seeks to preserve his life will lose it, but whoever loses it will save it.
[[Lc 17,34]]I tell you, on that night there will be two people in one bed; one will be taken, the other left.
[[Lc 17,35]]And there will be two women grinding meal together; one will be taken, the other left."
[[Lc 17,36]]
[[Lc 17,37]]They said to him in reply, "Where, Lord?" He said to them, "Where the body is, there also the vultures will gather."

first_reading.title: Second Letter of John
first_reading.text:
[[2_Jn 1,4]](Chosen Lady) I rejoiced greatly to find some of your children walking in the truth just as we were commanded by the Father.
[[2_Jn 1,5]]But now, Lady, I ask you, not as though I were writing a new commandment but the one we have had from the beginning: let us love one another.
[[2_Jn 1,6]]For this is love, that we walk according to his commandments; this is the commandment, as you heard from the beginning, in which you should walk.
[[2_Jn 1,7]]Many deceivers have gone out into the world, those who do not acknowledge Jesus Christ as coming in the flesh; such is the deceitful one and the antichrist.
[[2_Jn 1,8]]Look to yourselves that you do not lose what we worked for but may receive a full recompense.
[[2_Jn 1,9]]Anyone who is so "progressive" as not to remain in the teaching of the Christ does not have God; whoever remains in the teaching has the Father and the Son.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 119,1]]Blessed are they whose way is blameless, 
who walk in the law of the LORD.
[[Ps 119,2]]Blessed are they who observe his decrees, 
Who seek him with all their heart.

[[Ps 119,10]]With all my heart I seek you; 
let me not stray from your commands.
[[Ps 119,11]]Within my heart I treasure your promise, 
That I may not sin against you. 

[[Ps 119,17]]Be good to your servant, that I may live 
And keep your words.
[[Ps 119,18]]Open my eyes, that I may consider 
the wonders of your law.
